meanings.definition: To remove the intestines or entrails from (a fish or other animal)
meanings.sent1: The fisherman carefully gutted the trout before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: She always guts the fish before preparing it for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that gutting the fish was the least favorite part of his job.
meanings.sent4: The hunter gutted the deer swiftly, expertly removing its entrails.
meanings.sent5: The image of gutting the fish stayed in his mind long after the fishing trip.

meanings.sent1: The vandals gutted the abandoned house, leaving it in ruins.
meanings.sent2: The fire gutted the old building, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent3: The storm gutted the interior of the house, causing extensive damage.
meanings.sent4: The flood gutted the basement, destroying everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake gutted the historic building, leaving a trail of destruction.

meanings.definition: To feel extremely disappointed or upset
meanings.sent1: She was gutted when she didn't get the job she wanted.
meanings.sent2: He felt gutted after his team lost the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The kids were gutted when they found out the ice cream shop was closed.
meanings.sent4: I was gutted when my favorite show got canceled.
meanings.sent5: The students were gutted when they realized they missed the field trip.
